meanings.definition: The act of rejecting or the state of being rejected.
meanings.sent1: She felt sad after facing multiple rejections from job interviews.
meanings.sent2: His rejections of her invitations hurt her feelings.
meanings.sent3: The rejections from the universities made her rethink her study plans.
meanings.sent4: The rejections piled up like unopened letters on the desk of disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The rejections echoed loudly in her mind, drowning out any hope.

meanings.definition: The refusal to accept or consider something.
meanings.sent1: His rejections of the new policy were met with understanding by his team.
meanings.sent2: The rejections of his ideas by the committee were disheartening.
meanings.sent3: The rejections of the bland food were unanimous among the group.
meanings.sent4: The rejections of the outdated technology were long overdue.
meanings.sent5: The rejections of the proposal left him feeling dejected and unappreciated.

meanings.definition: The dismissal or refusal of a proposal, idea, or request.
meanings.sent1: The rejections of his project proposal were unexpected.
meanings.sent2: She faced rejections of her vacation request due to staff shortage.
meanings.sent3: The rejections of his suggestions were met with laughter by the team.
meanings.sent4: The rejections of his business plan were a setback, but he remained determined.
meanings.sent5: The rejections of his manuscript felt like a stab in the heart.
